metadata.title: CVE-2024-43821 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:scsi: lpfc: Fix a possible null pointer dereferenceIn function lpfc_xcvr_data_show, the memory allocation with kmalloc mightfail, thereby making rdp_context a null pointer. In the following contextand functions that use this pointer, there are dereferencing operations,leading to null pointer dereference.To fix this issue, a null pointer check should be added. If it is null,use scnprintf to notify the user and return len.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
